question.text: Cytochrome c is a small protein attached to the

options.text: outer surface of the outer mitochondrial membrane and acts as a mobile carrier for transfer of electrons between complex II and III
inner surface of the outer mitochondrial membrane and acts as a mobile carrier for transfer of electrons between complex III and IV
outer surface of the inner mitochondrial membrane and acts as a mobile carrier for transfer of electrons between complex III and IV
inner surface of the inner mitochondrial membrane and acts as a mobile carrier for transfer of electrons between complex III and IV

solution.text: The ETS contains various cytochromes. Cytochrome bc1 complex (complex III) and cytochrome aa<sub>3</sub> complex (complex IV) are attached to the inner mitochondrial membrane. Cytochrome c is a small protein attached to the outer surface of the inner membrane and acts as a mobile carrier for transfer of electrons between complex III and IV.
